elements.name: Price Calculator Panel
elements.problem_it_solves: Budget-constrained guests like Tamycka need to see total configured cost as the primary number, not per-night rate, with all fees included and savings highlighted.
elements.description: A live price calculator panel for the listing page that inverts the standard e-commerce price hierarchy. The total cost for the guest's configured schedule is the dominant visual element (28px bold primary purple), with per-night rate as secondary context and a savings indicator in success purple. Includes day-of-week selectors, a duration stepper, and an 'Includes all fees' transparency line. Updates optimistically on interaction.
elements.html_css:

elements.name: Social Proof Badge with Family Verification
elements.problem_it_solves: Parent guests like Tamycka need similarity-based social proof from other families to resolve child-safety uncertainty, placed at the point of evaluation alongside the listing title.
elements.description: A compact social proof badge system for listing pages featuring two badge types: a general recurring-guest badge (DM Sans pill showing guest count and average stay) and a family-friendly verification badge (shield icon with blue accent showing family count and safety features). Both placed inline as metadata in the listing header zone.
elements.html_css:
Bright Studio near Madison Square Garden

Midtown West, Manhattan · 34th St

A mother of two (ages 2 and 5) · 8-week stay

elements.name: Weekly Micro-Review Card
elements.problem_it_solves: Recurring guests need a fast, voluntary micro-review mechanism that builds written commitment evidence after each stay, without feeling like an obligation.
elements.description: An inline review prompt card that appears in the Stays Manager timeline after a completed stay. Features a one-tap 5-star rating, optional one-line note, and a completed state that shows the guest's contribution as part of their commitment evidence. Dismissible without penalty. Includes running average display for guests with 3+ reviews.
elements.html_css:
Thu Feb 13 – Sat Feb 15

Your stay at Sherene's

elements.name: Stay Timeline with Commitment Evidence
elements.problem_it_solves: Recurring guests need to see their accumulated stay history as a growing narrative of belonging, not as a billing ledger, to reinforce commitment through visible evidence.
elements.description: A Stay Timeline header for the Leases/Stays Manager page that surfaces commitment evidence: total stays, average rating, review count, and a visual timeline of recent stays. Includes a milestone marker at the 10-stay mark. The summary stats appear above the functional controls (date changes, payments), ensuring the guest sees their investment before their obligations.

elements.name: Proposal Confirmation Card
elements.problem_it_solves: After proposal submission (the guest's biggest commitment), the confirmation must capitalize on Cialdini's racetrack confidence spike by reflecting the specific decision, normalizing it with social proof, and providing forward momentum.
elements.description: A proposal confirmation card that appears after the guest submits their proposal. Shows the specific proposal details (host name, schedule, price, savings), social proof normalization ('Join X recurring guests'), and a concrete next step with expected timeline. Designed to reinforce the commitment decision and prevent post-submission doubt.

elements.name: How It Works Process Explainer
elements.problem_it_solves: First-time guests like Tamycka have deep process uncertainty (7 questions in one phone call) that the platform must answer proactively with a compact, social-proof-enhanced process overview.
elements.description: A compact 4-step process explainer module that answers the seven process questions Tamycka asked in her call. Each step is under 10 words. The module includes social proof normalization ('200+ guests have done this') and is designed to appear on the homepage and listing pages without scrolling. Breaks pluralistic ignorance by showing that the process is well-trodden.
